meanings.definition: A person who believes in or predicts a decline or deterioration in a particular aspect of society or culture.
meanings.sent1: The declinist warned of a coming downfall in the economy.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a declinist for her negative outlook on the environment.
meanings.sent3: The declinist at the party joked about the decline of the snack supply.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a declinist made him unpopular among optimists.
meanings.sent5: The declinist's predictions always seemed to come true, much to everyone's dismay.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the belief in or prediction of a decline or deterioration.
meanings.sent1: The declinist perspective on the situation was quite pessimistic.
meanings.sent2: Her declinist views on the industry were not well-received by her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The declinist forecast for the weather was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The declinist tone of the report painted a bleak picture of the future.
meanings.sent5: His declinist attitude colored everything he said, making it all sound negative.
